newsitem.title: UK: Oil rig back under tow off Scottish coast.
newsitem.headline: Oil rig back under tow off Scottish coast.

text.p: A North Sea oil rig platform with 69 people on board was reconnected to a tow line on Tuesday after it drifted loose off the Scottish coast in heavy seas, coastguards said.
The Aberdeen coastguard said a tow line was fixed to the mobile drilling rig Sedco Explorer, which had been drifting about 80 miles east of the Scottish coast.
A spokesman for the rig said: "We had a situation this morning when the Sedco Explorer broke a tow line, but we have re-established that line and are holding the position."
He said there were no plans to evacuate the rig or carry out any emergency procedures, although an emergency team was standing by as a precaution.
Gales and heavy rain lashed Britain overnight, injuring several people, blocking roads and leaving thousands of homes without power, emergency services said.
